thread.title: STC signs two new partnership deals
thread.title_full: STC signs two new partnership deals | MENAFN.COM

author: Arab News
title: STC signs two new partnership deals
text:
(MENAFN - Arab News) The Saudi Telecom Co. (STC) has signed two partnership agreements with Souq.com and Booking.com allowing STC customers to trade Qitaf (loyalty) points for purchases and services from both sites. 
The Souq.com agreement was signed in Dubai during Gitex 2015 by Ahmed A. Alsahhaf GM of marketing communications from STC and by Ronaldo Mouchawar Souq.com CEO. The Booking.com agreement was signed also by Ahmed A. Alsahhaf and Yuost Vermeulen regional manager for MEA hotels on behalf of Booking.com. 
Souq.com is claimed to be the largest e-commerce platform in the Arab world offering more than 4 products including electronics fashion household products watches perfumes etc. and attracts more than 23 million visitors per month. 
Booking.com offers competitive hotel rates and an easy efficient and inexpensive way for leisure and business travelers to choose and book accommodation from a wide range of choices irrespective of destination. A team of more than 10000 multilingual customer service representatives support customers 24/7. 
The deals are part of STC's drive to maintain its market leadership and provide customers enhanced services and benefits. The Qitaf loyalty program is the largest loyalty program of its kind in the Middle East in terms of the number of customers and program partners.
